Model

Class Customer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Customer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Customer>

    public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Customer>, java.io.Serializable
    Class Customer ~ represent a single customer/fan of the league
    Author:
    Java Course Team 2018 - Shai Gutman, University Of Haifa - Israel, ID: 205791056
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addSubscription

        public boolean addSubscription(Subscription subscription)
        This method adds a new Subscription to the subscriptions array only if the given subscription doesn't already exist in the Customer's subscriptions array.
        Parameters:
        subscription - to be added
        Returns:
        true if this subscription was successfully added, false otherwise

      • removeSubscription

        public boolean removeSubscription(Subscription subscription)
        This method removes an existing subscription from the subscriptions array only if the subscription exists
        Parameters:
        subscription - to be removed
        Returns:
        true if this subscription was removed successfully, false otherwise

      • getNumOfCustomerSubscriptions

        public int getNumOfCustomerSubscriptions()
        This method counts the number of the valid subscriptions that belongs to the customer. a valid subscription is a subscription that its last date is after today.
        Returns:
        customerSubs number of subscriptions

      • addMatch

        public boolean addMatch(Match match)
        This method adds a given match to the first valid subscription of the customer a subscription is defined valid iff: 1. its last date wasn't expired 2. the subscription's stadium is the home team's stadium *subscription's stadium is the working stadium of the receptionist that sold the subscription IMPORTANT: the match will be added only if its time doesn't ovelap with any other match in the valid subscription
        Parameters:
        match - to be added
        Returns:
        true if the match was added successfully, false otherwise

      • removeMatch

        public boolean removeMatch(Match match)
        This method removes a given match from the relevant subscription
        Parameters:
        match - to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the match was removed successfully, false otherwise

      • checkId

        public static java.lang.String checkId(java.lang.String id)
        This method gets a string and checks if the string is a valid ID number
        Parameters:
        id - to be checked
        Returns:
        the id if it's a valid id, "0" otherwise
        See Also:
        Constants
